newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Power cut halts business in southern Philippines.
newsitem.headline: Power cut halts business in southern Philippines.

text.p: Industry in parts of the southern Philippine island of Mindanao came to a halt on Friday because of a power failure, officials of state-run National Power Corp (Napocor) said.
"Power is currently being restored...helicopter patrols will be undertaken to determine exact cause of interruption," said Napocor vice-president Pasayod Macarambon.
The official said electricity supply to two thirds of the island, including five major cities, was cut since 9.41 a.m. (0141 GMT). The failure affected six provinces on Mindanao island.
Other Napocor officials said they had received complaints from factories and other industrial companies that had to halt operations because of the power outage.

Mindanao has suffered intermittent power failures in recent months after unidentified men suspected by police to be Moslem separatist guerrillas or disgruntled workers destroyed Napocor transmission equipment.
